title: FPS problem, likely tied to high end Nvidia GFX
body:
Hey there

Just want to inform that I'm sitting on this PC:
i7-2600k@4,2-4,8 GHz
16 Gb 2133 MHz Ram
1080 Ti
144 MHz 1440p Monitor (ASUS PG279Q)

And I can barely peak at 144 MHz... I had the same problem with my 980 Ti, same shit, hovering between 100-160 FPS uncapped.

For shits and giggles I tried my old Radeon 6850, and guess what - 250+ FPS...

Both Nvidia cards works just fine in all other games, and this seems mainly to be Riot spaghetti problem - is this being looked in to? Might ofcourse be a Nvidia problem, but I don't think so. :P

Lastly, had similar results using a 4790k, 32 Gb ram, and same GFXs tried.

EDIT: Oh, and anyone happen to have a solution? Haven't been able to find one, either myself or online. ;)

replies.body: Check your Power options. Sometimes the chosen option can lead to worser FPS. Try them out and see if they do anything.

You can run into issues if your PC is too good.  >.<  Check our our [high spec pc guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209010626-Frame-Skipping-on-High-End-PCs) to help get this fixed.  Your best bet may be to cap your framerate via your in-game video settings.
